setup_azure_migrate_environment.title: Setup Comprehensive Azure Migrate Environment
setup_azure_migrate_environment.code:
# Setup Azure Migrate environment for enterprise migration

echo "Setting up Azure Migrate environment..."

# Create resource group for migration
az group create \
  --name migration-hub-rg \
  --location eastus \
  --tags Environment=Migration Project=CloudTransformation CostCenter=IT002

# Create Azure Migrate project
echo "Creating Azure Migrate project..."
MIGRATE_PROJECT_NAME="migrate-enterprise-project"
az migrate project create \
  --location eastus \
  --name $MIGRATE_PROJECT_NAME \
  --resource-group migration-hub-rg

# Create Log Analytics workspace for migration monitoring
echo "Creating Log Analytics workspace..."
az monitor log-analytics workspace create \
  --resource-group migration-hub-rg \
  --workspace-name migration-monitoring-workspace \
  --location eastus \
  --sku pergb2018

MIGRATE_WORKSPACE_ID=$(az monitor log-analytics workspace show \
  --resource-group migration-hub-rg \
  --workspace-name migration-monitoring-workspace \
  --query customerId -o tsv)

# Create Recovery Services Vault for backup and disaster recovery
echo "Creating Recovery Services Vault..."
RECOVERY_VAULT_NAME="migrate-recovery-vault"
az backup vault create \
  --resource-group migration-hub-rg \
  --name $RECOVERY_VAULT_NAME \
  --location eastus \
  --storage-model-type GeoRedundant

# Create virtual network for migration target environment
echo "Creating migration target network..."
az network vnet create \
  --resource-group migration-hub-rg \
  --name migration-target-vnet \
  --address-prefixes 10.10.0.0/16 \
  --subnet-name migration-subnet \
  --subnet-prefixes 10.10.1.0/24

# Create additional subnets for different tiers
az network vnet subnet create \
  --resource-group migration-hub-rg \
  --vnet-name migration-target-vnet \
  --name database-subnet \
  --address-prefixes 10.10.2.0/24

az network vnet subnet create \
  --resource-group migration-hub-rg \
  --vnet-name migration-target-vnet \
  --name application-subnet \
  --address-prefixes 10.10.3.0/24

az network vnet subnet create \
  --resource-group migration-hub-rg \
  --vnet-name migration-target-vnet \
  --name bastion-subnet \
  --address-prefixes 10.10.4.0/27

# Create Azure Bastion for secure access
echo "Creating Azure Bastion for secure access..."
az network public-ip create \
  --resource-group migration-hub-rg \
  --name bastion-public-ip \
  --sku Standard \
  --location eastus

az network bastion create \
  --resource-group migration-hub-rg \
  --name migration-bastion \
  --public-ip-address bastion-public-ip \
  --vnet-name migration-target-vnet \
  --location eastus

# Create Key Vault for migration secrets and certificates
echo "Creating Key Vault for migration secrets..."
KEY_VAULT_NAME="migrate-kv-$(openssl rand -hex 3)"
az keyvault create \
  --resource-group migration-hub-rg \
  --name $KEY_VAULT_NAME \
  --location eastus \
  --enable-soft-delete true \
  --enable-purge-protection true

# Create storage account for migration artifacts
echo "Creating storage account for migration artifacts..."
MIGRATE_STORAGE_NAME="migratestorage$(openssl rand -hex 3)"
az storage account create \
  --resource-group migration-hub-rg \
  --name $MIGRATE_STORAGE_NAME \
  --location eastus \
  --sku Standard_LRS \
  --kind StorageV2

# Create containers for different migration artifacts
az storage container create \
  --account-name $MIGRATE_STORAGE_NAME \
  --name assessment-reports \
  --auth-mode login

az storage container create \
  --account-name $MIGRATE_STORAGE_NAME \
  --name migration-scripts \
  --auth-mode login

az storage container create \
  --account-name $MIGRATE_STORAGE_NAME \
  --name backup-artifacts \
  --auth-mode login

echo "Azure Migrate environment setup completed."
echo "Migrate Project: $MIGRATE_PROJECT_NAME"
echo "Recovery Vault: $RECOVERY_VAULT_NAME"
echo "Key Vault: $KEY_VAULT_NAME"
echo "Storage Account: $MIGRATE_STORAGE_NAME"

setup_database_migration_service.title: Setup Advanced Database Migration Service
setup_database_migration_service.code:
# Setup Azure Database Migration Service for complex scenarios

echo "Setting up Database Migration Service..."

# Create DMS service (Premium tier for advanced features)
DMS_SERVICE_NAME="dms-enterprise-service"
az dms create \
  --resource-group migration-hub-rg \
  --name $DMS_SERVICE_NAME \
  --location eastus \
  --sku Premium_4vCores \
  --vnet-subnet-id $(az network vnet subnet show --resource-group migration-hub-rg --vnet-name migration-target-vnet --name migration-subnet --query id -o tsv) \
  --tags Environment=Migration Service=DatabaseMigration

# Create target Azure SQL Database (managed instance for complex scenarios)
echo "Creating target Azure SQL Managed Instance..."
SQL_MI_NAME="sqlmi-target-$(openssl rand -hex 3)"

# Note: SQL Managed Instance creation can take 4-6 hours
# For demonstration, we'll create a regular SQL Database and show the MI command
echo "Creating Azure SQL Database for migration target..."
SQL_SERVER_NAME="sql-migration-target-$(openssl rand -hex 3)"

az sql server create \
  --resource-group migration-hub-rg \
  --name $SQL_SERVER_NAME \
  --location eastus \
  --admin-user sqladmin \
  --admin-password 'MigrateP@ssw0rd123!' \
  --enable-public-network false

# Create target databases for different migration scenarios
echo "Creating target databases..."

# OLTP database
az sql db create \
  --resource-group migration-hub-rg \
  --server $SQL_SERVER_NAME \
  --name northwind-migrated \
  --edition Premium \
  --capacity 125 \
  --max-size 100GB

# Data warehouse database
az sql db create \
  --resource-group migration-hub-rg \
  --server $SQL_SERVER_NAME \
  --name datawarehouse-migrated \
  --edition Premium \
  --capacity 250 \
  --max-size 500GB

# Create Cosmos DB for NoSQL migration scenarios
echo "Creating Cosmos DB for NoSQL migration..."
COSMOS_ACCOUNT_NAME="cosmos-migration-$(openssl rand -hex 3)"
az cosmosdb create \
  --resource-group migration-hub-rg \
  --name $COSMOS_ACCOUNT_NAME \
  --locations regionName=eastus failoverPriority=0 \
  --default-consistency-level Session \
  --enable-multiple-write-locations false

# Create databases and containers for different data types
az cosmosdb sql database create \
  --resource-group migration-hub-rg \
  --account-name $COSMOS_ACCOUNT_NAME \
  --name migrated-mongodb

az cosmosdb sql container create \
  --resource-group migration-hub-rg \
  --account-name $COSMOS_ACCOUNT_NAME \
  --database-name migrated-mongodb \
  --name products \
  --partition-key-path '/categoryId' \
  --throughput 1000

az cosmosdb sql container create \
  --resource-group migration-hub-rg \
  --account-name $COSMOS_ACCOUNT_NAME \
  --database-name migrated-mongodb \
  --name customers \
  --partition-key-path '/region' \
  --throughput 800

# Create private endpoints for secure connectivity
echo "Creating private endpoints for databases..."

# SQL Server private endpoint
az network private-endpoint create \
  --resource-group migration-hub-rg \
  --name sql-server-pe \
  --vnet-name migration-target-vnet \
  --subnet database-subnet \
  --private-connection-resource-id $(az sql server show --resource-group migration-hub-rg --name $SQL_SERVER_NAME --query id -o tsv) \
  --group-id sqlServer \
  --connection-name sql-server-connection

# Cosmos DB private endpoint
az network private-endpoint create \
  --resource-group migration-hub-rg \
  --name cosmos-db-pe \
  --vnet-name migration-target-vnet \
  --subnet database-subnet \
  --private-connection-resource-id $(az cosmosdb show --resource-group migration-hub-rg --name $COSMOS_ACCOUNT_NAME --query id -o tsv) \
  --group-id Sql \
  --connection-name cosmos-db-connection

echo "Database migration infrastructure created successfully."
echo "DMS Service: $DMS_SERVICE_NAME"
echo "SQL Server: $SQL_SERVER_NAME"
echo "Cosmos DB: $COSMOS_ACCOUNT_NAME"

create_complex_migration_projects.title: Create Complex Database Migration Projects
create_complex_migration_projects.code:
# Create complex database migration projects with DMS

echo "Creating database migration projects..."

# Create DMS project for SQL Server to Azure SQL Database migration
echo "Creating SQL Server migration project..."
DMS_PROJECT_SQLSERVER="sqlserver-migration-project"

# Create project configuration
cat > sqlserver-migration-config.json << 'EOF'
{
  "sourcePlatform": "SQL",
  "targetPlatform": "SQLDB",
  "location": "eastus"
}
EOF

# Note: DMS project creation via CLI requires REST API calls
# This demonstrates the configuration structure

# Create migration task configuration for online migration
cat > online-migration-task.json << 'EOF'
{
  "taskType": "Migrate.SqlServer.SqlDb",
  "input": {
    "sourceConnectionInfo": {
      "serverName": "source-sql-server.domain.com",
      "authentication": "SqlAuthentication",
      "userName": "sa",
      "password": "SourcePassword123!",
      "encryptConnection": true,
      "trustServerCertificate": true
    },
    "targetConnectionInfo": {
      "serverName": "SQL_SERVER_NAME.database.windows.net",
      "authentication": "SqlAuthentication",
      "userName": "sqladmin",
      "password": "MigrateP@ssw0rd123!",
      "encryptConnection": true
    },
    "selectedDatabases": [
      {
        "name": "Northwind",
        "targetDatabaseName": "northwind-migrated",
        "makeSourceDbReadOnly": false,
        "tableMap": {
          "dbo.Customers": "dbo.Customers",
          "dbo.Orders": "dbo.Orders",
          "dbo.Products": "dbo.Products",
          "dbo.OrderDetails": "dbo.OrderDetails"
        }
      }
    ]
  }
}
EOF

sed -i "s/SQL_SERVER_NAME/$SQL_SERVER_NAME/g" online-migration-task.json

# Create offline migration task for data warehouse
cat > offline-migration-task.json << 'EOF'
{
  "taskType": "Migrate.SqlServer.SqlDb",
  "input": {
    "sourceConnectionInfo": {
      "serverName": "source-dwh-server.domain.com",
      "authentication": "SqlAuthentication",
      "userName": "sa",
      "password": "SourcePassword123!",
      "encryptConnection": true,
      "trustServerCertificate": true
    },
    "targetConnectionInfo": {
      "serverName": "SQL_SERVER_NAME.database.windows.net",
      "authentication": "SqlAuthentication",
      "userName": "sqladmin",
      "password": "MigrateP@ssw0rd123!",
      "encryptConnection": true
    },
    "selectedDatabases": [
      {
        "name": "DataWarehouse",
        "targetDatabaseName": "datawarehouse-migrated",
        "makeSourceDbReadOnly": true,
        "tableMap": {
          "dbo.FactSales": "dbo.FactSales",
          "dbo.DimCustomer": "dbo.DimCustomer",
          "dbo.DimProduct": "dbo.DimProduct",
          "dbo.DimTime": "dbo.DimTime"
        },
        "migrationSetting": {
          "EnableMigrationValidation": true,
          "EnableDataIntegrityValidation": true,
          "EnableQueryAnalysisValidation": true
        }
      }
    ]
  }
}
EOF

sed -i "s/SQL_SERVER_NAME/$SQL_SERVER_NAME/g" offline-migration-task.json

# Create MongoDB to Cosmos DB migration configuration
echo "Creating MongoDB to Cosmos DB migration configuration..."
cat > mongodb-cosmosdb-migration.json << 'EOF'
{
  "source": {
    "connectionString": "mongodb://source-mongodb:27017",
    "database": "ecommerce",
    "collections": [
      {
        "name": "products",
        "shardKey": "categoryId",
        "targetContainer": "products"
      },
      {
        "name": "customers",
        "shardKey": "region", 
        "targetContainer": "customers"
      },
      {
        "name": "orders",
        "shardKey": "customerId",
        "targetContainer": "orders"
      }
    ]
  },
  "target": {
    "connectionString": "COSMOS_CONNECTION_STRING",
    "database": "migrated-mongodb",
    "throughput": {
      "shared": false,
      "perContainer": {
        "products": 1000,
        "customers": 800,
        "orders": 1200
      }
    }
  },
  "migrationSettings": {
    "batchSize": 1000,
    "maxParallelism": 10,
    "validateData": true,
    "createIndexes": true
  }
}
EOF

# Get Cosmos DB connection string
COSMOS_CONN_STRING=$(az cosmosdb keys list --resource-group migration-hub-rg --name $COSMOS_ACCOUNT_NAME --type connection-strings --query 'connectionStrings[0].connectionString' -o tsv)
sed -i "s/COSMOS_CONNECTION_STRING/$(echo $COSMOS_CONN_STRING | sed 's/\//\\\//g')/g" mongodb-cosmosdb-migration.json

# Create pre-migration validation script
echo "Creating pre-migration validation scripts..."
cat > pre-migration-validation.sql << 'EOF'
-- Pre-migration validation script for SQL Server
-- Run this script on source database before migration

-- Check database compatibility level
SELECT 
    name AS DatabaseName,
    compatibility_level AS CompatibilityLevel,
    CASE 
        WHEN compatibility_level >= 130 THEN 'Compatible'
        WHEN compatibility_level >= 120 THEN 'Compatible with minor issues'
        ELSE 'Requires upgrade'
    END AS AzureSQLCompatibility
FROM sys.databases
WHERE database_id > 4;

-- Check for unsupported features
SELECT 
    'SQL Server Agent Jobs' AS Feature,
    COUNT(*) AS Count,
    'Not supported in Azure SQL Database' AS AzureAlternative
FROM msdb.dbo.sysjobs
WHERE enabled = 1
UNION ALL
SELECT 
    'Linked Servers' AS Feature,
    COUNT(*) AS Count,
    'Use Elastic Query or Azure Data Factory' AS AzureAlternative
FROM sys.servers
WHERE is_linked = 1
UNION ALL
SELECT 
    'Database Mail' AS Feature,
    COUNT(*) AS Count,
    'Use Logic Apps or Azure Functions' AS AzureAlternative
FROM msdb.dbo.sysmail_profile;

-- Check database size and storage requirements
SELECT 
    DB_NAME() AS DatabaseName,
    SUM(CAST(FILEPROPERTY(name, 'SpaceUsed') AS bigint) * 8192.) / 1024 / 1024 / 1024 AS UsedSpaceGB,
    SUM(size * 8192.) / 1024 / 1024 / 1024 AS AllocatedSpaceGB,
    CASE 
        WHEN SUM(size * 8192.) / 1024 / 1024 / 1024 <= 100 THEN 'Basic/Standard tier suitable'
        WHEN SUM(size * 8192.) / 1024 / 1024 / 1024 <= 1024 THEN 'Premium tier recommended'
        ELSE 'Consider SQL Managed Instance'
    END AS AzureRecommendation
FROM sys.database_files;

-- Check for performance-intensive objects
SELECT 
    'Tables' AS ObjectType,
    COUNT(*) AS Count,
    MAX(p.rows) AS MaxRows
FROM sys.tables t
INNER JOIN sys.partitions p ON t.object_id = p.object_id
WHERE p.index_id IN (0,1)
UNION ALL
SELECT 
    'Indexes' AS ObjectType,
    COUNT(*) AS Count,
    NULL AS MaxRows
FROM sys.indexes
WHERE type > 0
UNION ALL
SELECT 
    'Stored Procedures' AS ObjectType,
    COUNT(*) AS Count,
    NULL AS MaxRows
FROM sys.procedures
WHERE is_ms_shipped = 0;

-- Check for security objects
SELECT 
    'Database Users' AS SecurityObject,
    COUNT(*) AS Count
FROM sys.database_principals
WHERE type IN ('U', 'S')
UNION ALL
SELECT 
    'Database Roles' AS SecurityObject,
    COUNT(*) AS Count
FROM sys.database_principals
WHERE type = 'R' AND is_fixed_role = 0;
EOF

# Create post-migration validation script
cat > post-migration-validation.sql << 'EOF'
-- Post-migration validation script for Azure SQL Database
-- Run this script on target database after migration

-- Validate row counts
SELECT 
    SCHEMA_NAME(schema_id) AS SchemaName,
    name AS TableName,
    SUM(rows) AS RowCount
FROM sys.tables t
INNER JOIN sys.partitions p ON t.object_id = p.object_id
WHERE p.index_id IN (0,1)
GROUP BY SCHEMA_NAME(schema_id), name
ORDER BY SchemaName, TableName;

-- Check for missing indexes that might affect performance
SELECT 
    DB_NAME() AS DatabaseName,
    OBJECT_SCHEMA_NAME(object_id) AS SchemaName,
    OBJECT_NAME(object_id) AS TableName,
    ROUND(avg_total_user_cost * avg_user_impact * (user_seeks + user_scans), 0) AS IndexAdvantage,
    'CREATE INDEX IX_' + OBJECT_NAME(object_id) + '_' + 
        REPLACE(REPLACE(REPLACE(equality_columns, '[', ''), ']', ''), ', ', '_') + 
        ' ON ' + OBJECT_SCHEMA_NAME(object_id) + '.' + OBJECT_NAME(object_id) + 
        ' (' + equality_columns + ')' AS CreateIndexStatement
FROM sys.dm_db_missing_index_details AS mid
INNER JOIN sys.dm_db_missing_index_groups AS mig ON mid.index_handle = mig.index_handle
INNER JOIN sys.dm_db_missing_index_group_stats AS migs ON mig.index_group_handle = migs.group_handle
WHERE avg_total_user_cost * avg_user_impact * (user_seeks + user_scans) > 1000
ORDER BY IndexAdvantage DESC;

-- Validate data integrity
DBCC CHECKDB WITH NO_INFOMSGS, ALL_ERRORMSGS;

-- Check query performance compared to baseline
SELECT 
    query_hash,
    COUNT(*) AS ExecutionCount,
    AVG(total_elapsed_time / execution_count) AS AvgDurationMicroseconds,
    AVG(total_logical_reads / execution_count) AS AvgLogicalReads,
    AVG(total_physical_reads / execution_count) AS AvgPhysicalReads
FROM sys.dm_exec_query_stats
CROSS APPLY sys.dm_exec_sql_text(sql_handle)
WHERE creation_time > DATEADD(day, -1, GETDATE())
GROUP BY query_hash
ORDER BY AvgDurationMicroseconds DESC;
EOF

echo "Database migration projects and validation scripts created successfully."

key_takeaways: Azure Migrate provides more comprehensive assessment capabilities than AWS Migration Hub
Azure Database Migration Service supports more database engines and migration scenarios
Azure offers better hybrid migration capabilities with Azure Arc and Azure Stack
Cost optimization opportunities are more granular and immediate in Azure
Azure provides stronger governance and compliance frameworks during migration
Integration between Azure migration tools is more seamless than AWS counterparts
Azure supports more flexible migration patterns including phased and hybrid approaches
